thread.title: CBC extends Olympic broadcast rights with IOC through 2024
thread.title_full: CBC extends Olympic broadcast rights with IOC through 2024

title: CBC extends Olympic broadcast rights with IOC through 2024
text:
CBC extends Olympic broadcast rights with IOC through 2024 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Wednesday, October 21, 2015 10:48 AM CDT | Updated: Wednesday, October 21, 2015 10:59 AM CDT Canada`s Brady Leman reacts to his fourth place finish in the Men`s Ski Cross final at the Sochi Winter Olympics in Krasnaya Polyana, Russia, Feb. 20, 2014. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jonathan Hayward) Report an error LAUSANNE, SWITZERLAND - 
The Canadian Broadcasting Corp. has extended its exclusive Olympic broadcast rights deal in Canada through the 2024 Games. 
The International Olympic Committee says it awarded the rights to CBC/Radio-Canada for the 2022 Winter Games in Beijing and the 2024 Summer Olympics, whose site has not yet been selected. 
Terms of the deal were not announced. 
The CBC already held the rights through the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. 
IOC President Thomas Bach says the CBC will also continue to provide "year-round coverage of Olympic sports." 
He says both sides agreed to collaborate on the new Olympic Channel under development by the IOC. 
Hubert Lacroix, president of CBC/Radio-Canada, says "we are pleased that Canadians across the country will be able to continue to experience with their public broadcaster all the excitement of the Olympic Games." Sponsored Links
